definition: to not mind (at all, a bit)/to not care in the slightest
hair/drawing brush/(in the) least/one thousandth/currency unit, 0.1 yuan
(negative prefix)/not/no
to introduce/to lie between/between/shell/armor
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: You knew I did not mind regarding this.
sentences.chinese: 你知道我对此毫不介意。

sentences.english: He didn't seem at all upset at being almost knocked to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去对几乎被撞倒在地毫不介意。

sentences.english: A great man does not care about trifles.
I finally understand why will not mind lorrie to talk about her past.
sentences.chinese: 我终于明白罗莉为什么会毫不介意地谈起她的过去。

sentences.english: And I went alone, and I did not mind.
sentences.chinese: 我独自前往，但毫不介意。

sentences.english: E. g. He didn't seem to mind in the slightest.
sentences.chinese: 但他们丝毫不介意，一心只牵挂着你的安全。

definition: not to mind/unconcerned
to pay no attention to/not to mind
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
no trace of politeness/unrestrained (criticism)
confident/calm/natural/poised
grinning/smiling
cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
to turn a blind eye to
decline to comment/not express an opinion/be noncommittal/hedge
to act as though there were nobody else present/unselfconscious/fig. without regard for others
each minding his own business
you're welcome/don't mention it/impolite/rude/blunt
smiling/with a smile
to be calm and unruffled in the midst of chaos or at a busy time (idiom)
to care about/to take offense/to mind
